settings.heading: Minimized Risk ofInfection and Irritation
settings.text: With single use needle heads there is no need for disinfecting so risk of infection and irritation is minimized with disposable needle heads that are replaced every treatment

settings.heading: Visible results,minimal downtime
settings.text: Other needle heads that are reused become blunt and cause unnecessary damage to the skin, therefore prolonging recovery. New (sharp, straight) needle heads provide clean micro-injuries every treatment and allows minimal downtime due to less unnecessary skin damage.

settings.heading: Boost Serum Absorption
settings.text:
0.5mm needles infuse your skin with serum during the stamping process.

This enhanced serum penetration allows for better absorption and better results.

settings.heading: Dermatologist tested
settings.text:
You can perform Micro-Infusion from the convenience of your home frequently (every 2 weeks), which means you’re reaping longer-lasting results than you would from sporadic, expensive, in-office visits.

Our approach puts dermatologist-tested technology and skincare in your hands, guaranteeing you in-clinic-like results without any guesswork.

settings.heading: The best natural glow

I was also happy to to see how much my pigmentation had lightened after 3rd treatment :) I switch between the serums depending on how my skin is before the treatment.”

settings.heading: After just TWO treatments!
settings.text: "I personally think my products absorbed better, my skin looks a bit brighter and that larger acne scar on my right cheek has started to fade after just TWO treatments!”

Texture was soooo much smoother, my skin looked clear, glowy and healthy. The system was so easy to use and I can’t wait until my next treatment.”

My skin goes a little red straight after the treatment but that quickly goes away. It’s a little uncomfortable when I do it on my forehead but it’s fine everywhere else. Totally worth it!!!”

settings.heading: Amazing results!

settings.heading: Replacement Micro-Infusion needle heads
settings.text:
Sterile needles go into the skin at a depth of 0.5 mm, creating controlled trauma in your skin, which can help boost the feeling of firmness and smooth the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles.

New needle heads provide sharp, straight needles for every treatment and is designed for better efficacy, with a minimal downtime due to less unnecessary skin damage from reusing blunt needles.
[code]

settings.code:
0.5mm

needle length

24K gold

plated hypoallergenic microchannels

20pcs

surgical grade stainless steel needles

settings.text: Twist open the chamber of the device and fill with one ampule of serum. Twist on needle head with lid to close it tight.
Leave the device upside down for 1-2 minutes. During this time, wash your face and make sure your hands are clean
Once the serum has had enough time to make its way into the needles, you can take off the lid and start micro-infusing!
Start at the centre of the face and work your way outward to cover the full face. Take any leftover serum from the device and pat it onto your face and neck to leave on overnight.
Once treatment is completed, place lid back on the needle head. Twist the lid off and dispose safely. Open a new sterile needle head and put it on the device ready for your next treatment.

settings.heading: When will I see results, and how long will results last?
settings.text:
The Micro-infusion treatment delivers notable benefits, and you may begin to observe visible results shortly after, experiencing enhanced radiance, softened look of fine lines, and an overall refreshed complexion within the next day or two.

With each successive treatment, you'll enjoy visible improvements in your skin. This quick and convenient home facial is ideal for preparation before events, providing a swift enhancement to your skin's appearance.

Remember to maintain your regular skincare routine to complement the effects of micro-infusion and promote the long-term health, hydration, and radiance of your skin.

settings.heading: Is it painful? Does it hurt?
settings.text:
Most customers say that the treatment is virtually painless. Despite the needles being longer than those in typical at-home needling systems for enhanced effectiveness, the ultra-fine needles allow you to feel minimal discomfort during the treatment.

In the initial stages of the treatment, you might sense a slight prickling feeling as the needles make contact with the skin, but users typically quickly adapt to this sensation.

settings.heading: Can you use it around the eyes and on the neck?
settings.text:
Micro-Infusion was designed for the facial area, we recommend avoiding delicate skin areas like the eyes. Applying the device around the eye area may cause sensitivity. If you choose to micro-infuse the eye area, exercise caution, and apply a very gentle pressure to ensure optimal safety and comfort. Limit the passes to one and closely monitor your skin's response, as individual reactions may vary.

Performing Micro-Infusion on the neck is suitable for improving the appearance of fine lines and achieving a rejuvenated-looking complexion. It targets issues such as neck creases, horizontal lines, and age-related concerns, contributing to enhanced texture, tone, and youthfulness.

settings.heading: How often can I do the treatment?
settings.text: We recommend a Micro-Infusion treatment every 2 weeks for the best results.

settings.heading: When is the best time to perform a Micro-Infusion treatment?
settings.text: We recommend doing the treatment at night before bed. Avoid being in the sun and using makeup for 24 hours after the treatment. For more information on post treatment care,visit our safety guide.

settings.heading: What is the length of the needles?
settings.text: Qure’s Micro-Infusion system needle heads are 0.5mm length for “epidermal-needling” which is designed to enhance skin-care ingredient absorption and skin texture.

settings.heading: What are the benefits of Micro-Infusion?
settings.text:
The needles of the Micro-Infusion device and the stamping action triggers the body’s natural healing process.

The serum booster that you choose to infuse during your Micro-Infusion will determine the major benefits of your treatment. Very fine needles infuse micro-droplets of concentrated serum at a specific depth into the dermis (top layer) of your skin precisely where they are needed to accelerate absorption of active ingredients that target specific skin concerns.

You can switch up your treatments and even mix the two serums together!

A few more benefits:

  • Brighter and more even skin tone
  • Reduced appearance of dark spots, acne scars, fine lines, & wrinkles
  • Rejuvenated, glowing complexion
  • Reduced appearance of dark spots and acne scars for smoother looking skin texture

settings.heading: Are there any side effects?
settings.text:
Everyone’s skin is different. Users may experience a bit of skin redness for the first few hours after treatment. However, this should be minimal and disappear quickly.

We recommend consulting with your dermatologist or doctor before use if you suffer from any skin condition. A patch test on an area of your skin that isn't too exposed prior to treatment is also recommended, to have a better understanding of how your skin will react and the downtime you should expect.

settings.heading: What’s the difference between home micro-needling rolling and micro-infusion?
settings.text: Micro-infusion is typically more effective and safer than derma rolling because derma roller needles are reusable and often can be not cleaned properly, increasing the risk of spreading bacteria that may lead to irritation and breakouts. The reused needles can become blunt and potentially damage the skin. Unlike derma rollers, which work by dragging across the skin, Micro-Infusion utilizes pinpoint precision, reducing the risk of unnecessary skin damage. Additionally, with micro-infusion, you deliver active ingredient solutions to target your specific skin concerns, enhancing the results.

settings.heading: Is there any aftercare that I should follow post treatment?
settings.text: Yes there is! After you’ve infused your skin with all that skin boosting serum, try to keep the skin clean for 24 hours and follow carefully the guidelines on our treatment protocol our Micro-Infusion Safety Guide.

settings.heading: How do I clean the device?
settings.text:
Once you’ve finished stamping your way to brighter and plumper skin, follow the below cleaning instructions:

  • Twist off the needle head with the cap attached and safely dispose.
  • Wash the chamber out with water and gentle cleanser.
  • Let the device air dry completely, on a clean surface, before packing away.
  • Open a brand new needle head and attach the needle head onto the device. Ensure hands are clean and don’t open the cap of the needle head.
